Associate Newsletter April 2013
MBO Partners State of Gen X Report: Choice Not Circumstance Guides Path to Independent Work <http://www.mbopartners.com/state-of-independence/5-gen-x-independent-worker-facts>There’s been a lot of buzz surrounding our latest Independence Report on the state of Generation X independent workers in America.
The Gen X Report <http://www.mbopartners.com/state-of-independence/independent-workforce-index.html> is the latest phase of our bellwether independent workforce index and illuminates the motivations and challenges of America’s 5.9 million Gen X independent workers. “More than any other generation, Gen X independents provide insight into how independence is shaping a new mindset and approach to the way we work,” said Gene Zaino, CEO of MBO Partners. Some key themes from this report include: Click here to read the full press release <http://www.prweb.com/releases/2013/3/prweb10578601.htm>
Be Accessible to MBO’s World Class Clients via LinkedIn Revitalize your lead generation strategy! Improve your chances of enabling MBO’s world-class clients to find and discuss potential opportunities with you by indicating that you are an MBO Associate via LinkedIn. When you add MBO as your company of record on LinkedIn, you make it easier for our clients to find, connect and engage with you, while expanding your own network to include fellow MBO Associates. To start, click “Edit Profile,” then in the “Experience” section, click “Add a position.” For “Company name,” type in MBO Partners, and select it from the list that appears to ensure the MBO logo shows up in your profile. Fill out the title as “MBO Associate” and voila, you’re done! For assistance please contact Marcelle Saab <mailto:msaab@mbopartners.com>. Also, please remember to join our Independent Consultants Group (ICG) <http://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=71161&trk=hb_side_g>, where you can stay up-to-date on the world of independent consulting and explore the subgroups we will add in the coming weeks to gain strategic connections based on industry and function. MBO Launches Spring Ad Campaign <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/IfOnlyPrintAd.pdf>Our “Cure the If Only’s” ad campaign is live! The campaign focuses on removing mental and logistical barriers to achieving success as an independent. Look out for our online ads across the internet. If you live or work in the DC area, listen for our new spot on NPR and look out for our ad in top business magazines like Forbes and Fortune! Additionally, we have some new collateral: click here <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/2013-MBO-Services-Brochure.pdf> to check out our brochure, and email Jaime MacDonell with any questions or feedback.
Get Your Referrals in before May 31! <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program>We’re getting close to MBO’s Home Office Makeover Drawing <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program/mbo-makeover>! Our greatest compliment is when an Associate like you spreads the word about us to friends and colleagues that would benefit from utilizing our services. When you refer a friend, every referral you submit gives you a chance to win a home office makeover worth up to $5,000! You will also be giving your friend the opportunity to try us for free. Finally, if your friend likes what we do, we will deposit $500 into your Business Center upon their enrollment and subsequent client collected billings of $30,000. MARKETING CORNER Get to Know Dave Underhill From Oregon
Meet Oregon-based Associate Dave Underhill. When told that he had a knack for explaining things clearly, his love of teaching became his professional calling as president of his own corporate training company. Prior to becoming a full time independent professional, Underhill held roles that required extensive research, followed by presentations to large groups of people.
